titleStmt.title: An elegy on the death of Thomas Beddingfield esq; who was murdered by Mr. Thomas Barney at Norwich, on Sunday the 20th. day of July, 1684.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by George Croom, at the Blue-Ball, over against Baynar'd Castle, in Thames-street,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "The hearts of men can never be at ease ..."
Within mourning borders, with emblems and motto.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Blue-Ball, over against Baynar'd Castle, in Thames-street
